column4: i installed the linux-k7 driver but i dont have it as an option under GRUB...  is this ok?
Apparently this is right, linux-k7 is a dummy package for upgrade, replaced with linux-generic
before it used to give me the option to select it under Dapper
What do you see in grub? i386 or generic?
basically that is the new name for k7
that's the name for the default kernel as well
I think it detected your AMD chip, I'm just guessing this based on my install experience
although, is there a way to tell if it's using k7 features?
That command should tell you that it's been obsoleted by generic
other than that i have no idea, sorry : )
